12#include <cmath>

14#include "src/base/bits.h"
15#include "src/base/lazy-instance.h"

17#include "src/base/platform/memory.h"
18#include "src/base/platform/platform.h"
19#include "src/codegen/assembler.h"

21#include "src/codegen/ppc/constants-ppc.h"
22#include "src/codegen/register-configuration.h"
23#include "src/diagnostics/disasm.h"
24#include "src/execution/ppc/frame-constants-ppc.h"
25#include "src/heap/combined-heap.h"
26#include "src/heap/heap-inl.h" // For CodeSpaceMemoryModificationScope.
27#include "src/objects/objects-inl.h"
28#include "src/runtime/runtime-utils.h"
29#include "src/utils/ostreams.h"

31// Only build the simulator if not compiling for real PPC hardware.
32namespace v8 {
33namespace internal {
34
35DEFINE_LAZY_LEAKY_OBJECT_GETTER(Simulator::GlobalMonitor,
36 Simulator::GlobalMonitor::Get)
37
38// This macro provides a platform independent use of sscanf. The reason for
39// SScanF not being implemented in a platform independent way through
40// ::v8::internal::OS in the same way as SNPrintF is that the
41// Windows C Run-Time Library does not provide vsscanf.
42#define SScanF sscanf
43
44// The PPCDebugger class is used by the simulator while debugging simulated
45// PowerPC code.
46class PPCDebugger {
47 public:
48 explicit PPCDebugger(Simulator* sim) : sim_(sim) {}
49 void Debug();
50
51 private:
52 static const Instr kBreakpointInstr = (TWI | 0x1F * B21);
53 static const Instr kNopInstr = (ORI); // ori, 0,0,0
54
55 Simulator* sim_;
56
57 intptr_t GetRegisterValue(int regnum);
58 double GetRegisterPairDoubleValue(int regnum);
59 double GetFPDoubleRegisterValue(int regnum);
60 bool GetValue(const char* desc, intptr_t* value);
61 bool GetFPDoubleValue(const char* desc, double* value);
62
63 // Set or delete breakpoint (there can be only one).
64 bool SetBreakpoint(Instruction* break_pc);
65 void DeleteBreakpoint();
66
67 // Undo and redo the breakpoint. This is needed to bracket disassembly and
68 // execution to skip past the breakpoint when run from the debugger.
69 void UndoBreakpoint();
70 void RedoBreakpoint();
71};
72
73void Simulator::DebugAtNextPC() {
74 PrintF("Starting debugger on the next instruction:\n");
75 set_pc(get_pc() + kInstrSize);
76 PPCDebugger(this).Debug();
77}
78
79intptr_t PPCDebugger::GetRegisterValue(int regnum) {
80 return sim_->get_register(regnum);
81}
82
83double PPCDebugger::GetRegisterPairDoubleValue(int regnum) {
84 return sim_->get_double_from_register_pair(regnum);
85}
86
87double PPCDebugger::GetFPDoubleRegisterValue(int regnum) {
88 return sim_->get_double_from_d_register(regnum);
89}
90
91bool PPCDebugger::GetValue(const char* desc, intptr_t* value) {
92 int regnum = Registers::Number(desc);
93 if (regnum != kNoRegister) {
94 *value = GetRegisterValue(regnum);
95 return true;
96 }
97 if (strncmp(desc, "0x", 2) == 0) {
98 return SScanF(desc + 2, "%" V8PRIxPTR,
99 reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t*>(value)) == 1;
100 }
101 return SScanF(desc, "%" V8PRIuPTR, reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t*>(value)) == 1;
102}
103
104bool PPCDebugger::GetFPDoubleValue(const char* desc, double* value) {
105 int regnum = DoubleRegisters::Number(desc);
106 if (regnum != kNoRegister) {
107 *value = sim_->get_double_from_d_register(regnum);
108 return true;
109 }
110 return false;
111}
112
113bool PPCDebugger::SetBreakpoint(Instruction* break_pc) {
114 // Check if a breakpoint can be set. If not return without any side-effects.
115 if (sim_->break_pc_ != nullptr) {
116 return false;
117 }
118
119 // Set the breakpoint.
120 sim_->break_pc_ = break_pc;
121 sim_->break_instr_ = break_pc->InstructionBits();
122 // Not setting the breakpoint instruction in the code itself. It will be set
123 // when the debugger shell continues.
124 return true;
125}
126
127namespace {
128// This function is dangerous, but it's only available in non-production
129// (simulator) builds.
130void SetInstructionBitsInCodeSpace(Instruction* instr, Instr value,
131 Heap* heap) {
132 CodePageMemoryModificationScopeForDebugging scope(
133 MemoryChunkMetadata::FromAddress(reinterpret_cast<Address>(instr)));
134 instr->SetInstructionBits(value);
135}
136} // namespace
137
138void PPCDebugger::DeleteBreakpoint() {
139 UndoBreakpoint();
140 sim_->break_pc_ = nullptr;
141 sim_->break_instr_ = 0;
142}
143
144void PPCDebugger::UndoBreakpoint() {
145 if (sim_->break_pc_ != nullptr) {
146 SetInstructionBitsInCodeSpace(sim_->break_pc_, sim_->break_instr_,
147 sim_->isolate_->heap());
148 }
149}
150
151void PPCDebugger::RedoBreakpoint() {
152 if (sim_->break_pc_ != nullptr) {
153 SetInstructionBitsInCodeSpace(sim_->break_pc_, kBreakpointInstr,
154 sim_->isolate_->heap());
155 }
156}
157
158void PPCDebugger::Debug() {
159 if (v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) {
160 PrintF("Debugger disabled for differential fuzzing.\n");
161 return;
162 }
163 intptr_t last_pc = -1;
164 bool done = false;
165
166#define COMMAND_SIZE 63
167#define ARG_SIZE 255
168
169#define STR(a) #a
170#define XSTR(a) STR(a)
171
172 char cmd[COMMAND_SIZE + 1];
173 char arg1[ARG_SIZE + 1];
174 char arg2[ARG_SIZE + 1];
175 char* argv[3] = {cmd, arg1, arg2};
176
177 // make sure to have a proper terminating character if reaching the limit
178 cmd[COMMAND_SIZE] = 0;
179 arg1[ARG_SIZE] = 0;
180 arg2[ARG_SIZE] = 0;
181
182 // Unset breakpoint while running in the debugger shell, making it invisible
183 // to all commands.
184 UndoBreakpoint();
185 // Disable tracing while simulating
186 bool trace = v8_flags.trace_sim;
187 v8_flags.trace_sim = false;
188
189 while (!done && !sim_->has_bad_pc()) {
190 if (last_pc != sim_->get_pc()) {
191 disasm::NameConverter converter;
192 disasm::Disassembler dasm(converter);
193 // use a reasonably large buffer
194 v8::base::EmbeddedVector<char, 256> buffer;
195 dasm.InstructionDecode(buffer,
196 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(sim_->get_pc()));
197 PrintF(" 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %s\n", sim_->get_pc(), buffer.begin());
198 last_pc = sim_->get_pc();
199 }
200 char* line = ReadLine("sim> ");
201 if (line == nullptr) {
202 break;
203 } else {
204 char* last_input = sim_->last_debugger_input();
205 if (strcmp(line, "\n") == 0 && last_input != nullptr) {
206 line = last_input;
207 } else {
208 // Ownership is transferred to sim_;
209 sim_->set_last_debugger_input(line);
210 }
211 // Use sscanf to parse the individual parts of the command line. At the
212 // moment no command expects more than two parameters.
213 int argc = SScanF(line,
214 "%" XSTR(COMMAND_SIZE) "s "
215 "%" XSTR(ARG_SIZE) "s "
216 "%" XSTR(ARG_SIZE) "s",
217 cmd, arg1, arg2);
218 if ((strcmp(cmd, "si") == 0) || (strcmp(cmd, "stepi") == 0)) {
219 intptr_t value;
220
221 // If at a breakpoint, proceed past it.
222 if ((reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(sim_->get_pc()))
223 ->InstructionBits() == 0x7D821008) {
224 sim_->set_pc(sim_->get_pc() + kInstrSize);
225 } else {
226 sim_->ExecuteInstruction(
227 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(sim_->get_pc()));
228 }
229
230 if (argc == 2 && last_pc != sim_->get_pc() && GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
231 for (int i = 1; i < value; i++) {
232 disasm::NameConverter converter;
233 disasm::Disassembler dasm(converter);
234 // use a reasonably large buffer
235 v8::base::EmbeddedVector<char, 256> buffer;
236 dasm.InstructionDecode(buffer,
237 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(sim_->get_pc()));
238 PrintF(" 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %s\n", sim_->get_pc(),
239 buffer.begin());
240 sim_->ExecuteInstruction(
241 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(sim_->get_pc()));
242 }
243 }
244 } else if ((strcmp(cmd, "c") == 0) || (strcmp(cmd, "cont") == 0)) {
245 // If at a breakpoint, proceed past it.
246 if ((reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(sim_->get_pc()))
247 ->InstructionBits() == 0x7D821008) {
248 sim_->set_pc(sim_->get_pc() + kInstrSize);
249 } else {
250 // Execute the one instruction we broke at with breakpoints disabled.
251 sim_->ExecuteInstruction(
252 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(sim_->get_pc()));
253 }
254 // Leave the debugger shell.
255 done = true;
256 } else if ((strcmp(cmd, "p") == 0) || (strcmp(cmd, "print") == 0)) {
257 if (argc == 2 || (argc == 3 && strcmp(arg2, "fp") == 0)) {
258 intptr_t value;
259 double dvalue;
260 if (strcmp(arg1, "all") == 0) {
261 for (int i = 0; i < kNumRegisters; i++) {
262 value = GetRegisterValue(i);
263 PrintF(" %3s: %08" V8PRIxPTR,
264 RegisterName(Register::from_code(i)), value);
265 if ((argc == 3 && strcmp(arg2, "fp") == 0) && i < 8 &&
266 (i % 2) == 0) {
267 dvalue = GetRegisterPairDoubleValue(i);
268 PrintF(" (%f)\n", dvalue);
269 } else if (i != 0 && !((i + 1) & 3)) {
270 PrintF("\n");
271 }
272 }
273 PrintF(" pc: %08" V8PRIxPTR " lr: %08" V8PRIxPTR
274 " "
275 "ctr: %08" V8PRIxPTR " xer: %08x cr: %08x\n",
276 sim_->special_reg_pc_, sim_->special_reg_lr_,
277 sim_->special_reg_ctr_, sim_->special_reg_xer_,
278 sim_->condition_reg_);
279 } else if (strcmp(arg1, "alld") == 0) {
280 for (int i = 0; i < kNumRegisters; i++) {
281 value = GetRegisterValue(i);
282 PrintF(" %3s: %08" V8PRIxPTR " %11" V8PRIdPTR,
283 RegisterName(Register::from_code(i)), value, value);
284 if ((argc == 3 && strcmp(arg2, "fp") == 0) && i < 8 &&
285 (i % 2) == 0) {
286 dvalue = GetRegisterPairDoubleValue(i);
287 PrintF(" (%f)\n", dvalue);
288 } else if (!((i + 1) % 2)) {
289 PrintF("\n");
290 }
291 }
292 PrintF(" pc: %08" V8PRIxPTR " lr: %08" V8PRIxPTR
293 " "
294 "ctr: %08" V8PRIxPTR " xer: %08x cr: %08x\n",
295 sim_->special_reg_pc_, sim_->special_reg_lr_,
296 sim_->special_reg_ctr_, sim_->special_reg_xer_,
297 sim_->condition_reg_);
298 } else if (strcmp(arg1, "allf") == 0) {
299 for (int i = 0; i < DoubleRegister::kNumRegisters; i++) {
300 dvalue = GetFPDoubleRegisterValue(i);
301 uint64_t as_words = base::bit_cast<uint64_t>(dvalue);
302 PrintF("%3s: %f 0x%08x %08x\n",
303 RegisterName(DoubleRegister::from_code(i)), dvalue,
304 static_cast<uint32_t>(as_words >> 32),
305 static_cast<uint32_t>(as_words & 0xFFFFFFFF));
306 }
307 } else if (arg1[0] == 'r' &&
308 (arg1[1] >= '0' && arg1[1] <= '9' &&
309 (arg1[2] == '\0' || (arg1[2] >= '0' && arg1[2] <= '9' &&
310 arg1[3] == '\0')))) {
311 int regnum = strtoul(&arg1[1], 0, 10);
312 if (regnum != kNoRegister) {
313 value = GetRegisterValue(regnum);
314 PrintF("%s: 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %" V8PRIdPTR "\n", arg1, value,
315 value);
316 } else {
317 PrintF("%s unrecognized\n", arg1);
318 }
319 } else {
320 if (GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
321 PrintF("%s: 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %" V8PRIdPTR "\n", arg1, value,
322 value);
323 } else if (GetFPDoubleValue(arg1, &dvalue)) {
324 uint64_t as_words = base::bit_cast<uint64_t>(dvalue);
325 PrintF("%s: %f 0x%08x %08x\n", arg1, dvalue,
326 static_cast<uint32_t>(as_words >> 32),
327 static_cast<uint32_t>(as_words & 0xFFFFFFFF));
328 } else {
329 PrintF("%s unrecognized\n", arg1);
330 }
331 }
332 } else {
333 PrintF("print <register>\n");
334 }
335 } else if ((strcmp(cmd, "po") == 0) ||
336 (strcmp(cmd, "printobject") == 0)) {
337 if (argc == 2) {
338 intptr_t value;
339 StdoutStream os;
340 if (GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
341 Tagged<Object> obj(value);
342 os << arg1 << ": \n";
343#ifdef DEBUG
344 Print(obj, os);
345 os << "\n";
346#else
347 os << Brief(obj) << "\n";
348#endif
349 } else {
350 os << arg1 << " unrecognized\n";
351 }
352 } else {
353 PrintF("printobject <value>\n");
354 }
355 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "setpc") == 0) {
356 intptr_t value;
357
358 if (!GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
359 PrintF("%s unrecognized\n", arg1);
360 continue;
361 }
362 sim_->set_pc(value);
363 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "stack") == 0 || strcmp(cmd, "mem") == 0 ||
364 strcmp(cmd, "dump") == 0) {
365 intptr_t* cur = nullptr;
366 intptr_t* end = nullptr;
367 int next_arg = 1;
368
369 if (strcmp(cmd, "stack") == 0) {
370 cur = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t*>(sim_->get_register(Simulator::sp));
371 } else { // "mem"
372 intptr_t value;
373 if (!GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
374 PrintF("%s unrecognized\n", arg1);
375 continue;
376 }
377 cur = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t*>(value);
378 next_arg++;
379 }
380
381 intptr_t words; // likely inaccurate variable name for 64bit
382 if (argc == next_arg) {
383 words = 10;
384 } else {
385 if (!GetValue(argv[next_arg], &words)) {
386 words = 10;
387 }
388 }
389 end = cur + words;
390
391 bool skip_obj_print = (strcmp(cmd, "dump") == 0);
392 while (cur < end) {
393 PrintF(" 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR ": 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %10" V8PRIdPTR,
394 reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(cur), *cur, *cur);
395 Tagged<Object> obj(*cur);
396 Heap* current_heap = sim_->isolate_->heap();
397 if (!skip_obj_print) {
398 if (IsSmi(obj) ||
399 IsValidHeapObject(current_heap, HeapObject::cast(obj))) {
400 PrintF(" (");
401 if (IsSmi(obj)) {
402 PrintF("smi %d", Smi::ToInt(obj));
403 } else {
404 ShortPrint(obj);
405 }
406 PrintF(")");
407 }
408 }
409 PrintF("\n");
410 cur++;
411 }
412 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "disasm") == 0 || strcmp(cmd, "di") == 0) {
413 disasm::NameConverter converter;
414 disasm::Disassembler dasm(converter);
415 // use a reasonably large buffer
416 v8::base::EmbeddedVector<char, 256> buffer;
417
418 uint8_t* prev = nullptr;
419 uint8_t* cur = nullptr;
420 uint8_t* end = nullptr;
421
422 if (argc == 1) {
423 cur = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(sim_->get_pc());
424 end = cur + (10 * kInstrSize);
425 } else if (argc == 2) {
426 int regnum = Registers::Number(arg1);
427 if (regnum != kNoRegister || strncmp(arg1, "0x", 2) == 0) {
428 // The argument is an address or a register name.
429 intptr_t value;
430 if (GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
431 cur = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(value);
432 // Disassemble 10 instructions at <arg1>.
433 end = cur + (10 * kInstrSize);
434 }
435 } else {
436 // The argument is the number of instructions.
437 intptr_t value;
438 if (GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
439 cur = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(sim_->get_pc());
440 // Disassemble <arg1> instructions.
441 end = cur + (value * kInstrSize);
442 }
443 }
444 } else {
445 intptr_t value1;
446 intptr_t value2;
447 if (GetValue(arg1, &value1) && GetValue(arg2, &value2)) {
448 cur = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(value1);
449 end = cur + (value2 * kInstrSize);
450 }
451 }
452
453 while (cur < end) {
454 prev = cur;
455 cur += dasm.InstructionDecode(buffer, cur);
456 PrintF(" 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR " %s\n", reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(prev),
457 buffer.begin());
458 }
459 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "gdb") == 0) {
460 PrintF("relinquishing control to gdb\n");
461 v8::base::OS::DebugBreak();
462 PrintF("regaining control from gdb\n");
463 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "break") == 0) {
464 if (argc == 2) {
465 intptr_t value;
466 if (GetValue(arg1, &value)) {
467 if (!SetBreakpoint(reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(value))) {
468 PrintF("setting breakpoint failed\n");
469 }
470 } else {
471 PrintF("%s unrecognized\n", arg1);
472 }
473 } else {
474 PrintF("break <address>\n");
475 }
476 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "del") == 0) {
477 DeleteBreakpoint();
478 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "cr") == 0) {
479 PrintF("Condition reg: %08x\n", sim_->condition_reg_);
480 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "lr") == 0) {
481 PrintF("Link reg: %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n", sim_->special_reg_lr_);
482 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "ctr") == 0) {
483 PrintF("Ctr reg: %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n", sim_->special_reg_ctr_);
484 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "xer") == 0) {
485 PrintF("XER: %08x\n", sim_->special_reg_xer_);
486 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "fpscr") == 0) {
487 PrintF("FPSCR: %08x\n", sim_->fp_condition_reg_);
488 } else if (strcmp(cmd, "stop") == 0) {
489 intptr_t value;
490 intptr_t stop_pc = sim_->get_pc() - (kInstrSize + kSystemPointerSize);
491 Instruction* stop_instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(stop_pc);
492 Instruction* msg_address =
493 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(stop_pc + kInstrSize);
494 if ((argc == 2) && (strcmp(arg1, "unstop") == 0)) {
495 // Remove the current stop.
496 if (sim_->isStopInstruction(stop_instr)) {
497 SetInstructionBitsInCodeSpace(stop_instr, kNopInstr,
498 sim_->isolate_->heap());
499 msg_address->SetInstructionBits(kNopInstr);
500 } else {
501 PrintF("Not at debugger stop.\n");
502 }
503 } else if (argc == 3) {
504 // Print information about all/the specified breakpoint(s).
505 if (strcmp(arg1, "info") == 0) {
506 if (strcmp(arg2, "all") == 0) {
507 PrintF("Stop information:\n");
508 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < sim_->kNumOfWatchedStops; i++) {
509 sim_->PrintStopInfo(i);
510 }
511 } else if (GetValue(arg2, &value)) {
512 sim_->PrintStopInfo(value);
513 } else {
514 PrintF("Unrecognized argument.\n");
515 }
516 } else if (strcmp(arg1, "enable") == 0) {
517 // Enable all/the specified breakpoint(s).
518 if (strcmp(arg2, "all") == 0) {
519 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < sim_->kNumOfWatchedStops; i++) {
520 sim_->EnableStop(i);
521 }
522 } else if (GetValue(arg2, &value)) {
523 sim_->EnableStop(value);
524 } else {
525 PrintF("Unrecognized argument.\n");
526 }
527 } else if (strcmp(arg1, "disable") == 0) {
528 // Disable all/the specified breakpoint(s).
529 if (strcmp(arg2, "all") == 0) {
530 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < sim_->kNumOfWatchedStops; i++) {
531 sim_->DisableStop(i);
532 }
533 } else if (GetValue(arg2, &value)) {
534 sim_->DisableStop(value);
535 } else {
536 PrintF("Unrecognized argument.\n");
537 }
538 }
539 } else {
540 PrintF("Wrong usage. Use help command for more information.\n");
541 }
542 } else if ((strcmp(cmd, "t") == 0) || strcmp(cmd, "trace") == 0) {
543 v8_flags.trace_sim = !v8_flags.trace_sim;
544 PrintF("Trace of executed instructions is %s\n",
545 v8_flags.trace_sim ? "on" : "off");
546 } else if ((strcmp(cmd, "h") == 0) || (strcmp(cmd, "help") == 0)) {
547 PrintF("cont\n");
548 PrintF(" continue execution (alias 'c')\n");
549 PrintF("stepi [num instructions]\n");
550 PrintF(" step one/num instruction(s) (alias 'si')\n");
551 PrintF("print <register>\n");
552 PrintF(" print register content (alias 'p')\n");
553 PrintF(" use register name 'all' to display all integer registers\n");
554 PrintF(
555 " use register name 'alld' to display integer registers "
556 "with decimal values\n");
557 PrintF(" use register name 'rN' to display register number 'N'\n");
558 PrintF(" add argument 'fp' to print register pair double values\n");
559 PrintF(
560 " use register name 'allf' to display floating-point "
561 "registers\n");
562 PrintF("printobject <register>\n");
563 PrintF(" print an object from a register (alias 'po')\n");
564 PrintF("cr\n");
565 PrintF(" print condition register\n");
566 PrintF("lr\n");
567 PrintF(" print link register\n");
568 PrintF("ctr\n");
569 PrintF(" print ctr register\n");
570 PrintF("xer\n");
571 PrintF(" print XER\n");
572 PrintF("fpscr\n");
573 PrintF(" print FPSCR\n");
574 PrintF("stack [<num words>]\n");
575 PrintF(" dump stack content, default dump 10 words)\n");
576 PrintF("mem <address> [<num words>]\n");
577 PrintF(" dump memory content, default dump 10 words)\n");
578 PrintF("dump [<words>]\n");
579 PrintF(
580 " dump memory content without pretty printing JS objects, default "
581 "dump 10 words)\n");
582 PrintF("disasm [<instructions>]\n");
583 PrintF("disasm [<address/register>]\n");
584 PrintF("disasm [[<address/register>] <instructions>]\n");
585 PrintF(" disassemble code, default is 10 instructions\n");
586 PrintF(" from pc (alias 'di')\n");
587 PrintF("gdb\n");
588 PrintF(" enter gdb\n");
589 PrintF("break <address>\n");
590 PrintF(" set a break point on the address\n");
591 PrintF("del\n");
592 PrintF(" delete the breakpoint\n");
593 PrintF("trace (alias 't')\n");
594 PrintF(" toogle the tracing of all executed statements\n");
595 PrintF("stop feature:\n");
596 PrintF(" Description:\n");
597 PrintF(" Stops are debug instructions inserted by\n");
598 PrintF(" the Assembler::stop() function.\n");
599 PrintF(" When hitting a stop, the Simulator will\n");
600 PrintF(" stop and give control to the PPCDebugger.\n");
601 PrintF(" The first %d stop codes are watched:\n",
602 Simulator::kNumOfWatchedStops);
603 PrintF(" - They can be enabled / disabled: the Simulator\n");
604 PrintF(" will / won't stop when hitting them.\n");
605 PrintF(" - The Simulator keeps track of how many times they \n");
606 PrintF(" are met. (See the info command.) Going over a\n");
607 PrintF(" disabled stop still increases its counter. \n");
608 PrintF(" Commands:\n");
609 PrintF(" stop info all/<code> : print infos about number <code>\n");
610 PrintF(" or all stop(s).\n");
611 PrintF(" stop enable/disable all/<code> : enables / disables\n");
612 PrintF(" all or number <code> stop(s)\n");
613 PrintF(" stop unstop\n");
614 PrintF(" ignore the stop instruction at the current location\n");
615 PrintF(" from now on\n");
616 } else {
617 PrintF("Unknown command: %s\n", cmd);
618 }
619 }
620 }
621
622 // Reinstall breakpoint to stop execution and enter the debugger shell when
623 // hit.
624 RedoBreakpoint();
625 // Restore tracing
626 v8_flags.trace_sim = trace;
627
628#undef COMMAND_SIZE
629#undef ARG_SIZE
630
631#undef STR
632#undef XSTR
633}
634
635bool Simulator::ICacheMatch(void* one, void* two) {
636 DCHECK_EQ(reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(one) & CachePage::kPageMask, 0);
637 DCHECK_EQ(reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(two) & CachePage::kPageMask, 0);
638 return one == two;
639}
640
641static uint32_t ICacheHash(void* key) {
642 return static_cast<uint32_t>(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(key)) >> 2;
643}
644
645static bool AllOnOnePage(uintptr_t start, int size) {
646 intptr_t start_page = (start & ~CachePage::kPageMask);
647 intptr_t end_page = ((start + size) & ~CachePage::kPageMask);
648 return start_page == end_page;
649}
650
651static bool is_snan(float input) {
652 uint32_t kQuietNanFPBit = 1 << 22;
653 uint32_t InputAsUint = base::bit_cast<uint32_t>(input);
654 return isnan(input) && ((InputAsUint & kQuietNanFPBit) == 0);
655}
656
657static bool is_snan(double input) {
658 uint64_t kQuietNanDPBit = 1L << 51;
659 uint64_t InputAsUint = base::bit_cast<uint64_t>(input);
660 return isnan(input) && ((InputAsUint & kQuietNanDPBit) == 0);
661}
662
663void Simulator::set_last_debugger_input(char* input) {
664 DeleteArray(last_debugger_input_);
665 last_debugger_input_ = input;
666}
667
668void Simulator::SetRedirectInstruction(Instruction* instruction) {
669 instruction->SetInstructionBits(rtCallRedirInstr | kCallRtRedirected);
670}
671
672void Simulator::FlushICache(base::CustomMatcherHashMap* i_cache,
673 void* start_addr, size_t size) {
674 intptr_t start = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(start_addr);
675 int intra_line = (start & CachePage::kLineMask);
676 start -= intra_line;
677 size += intra_line;
678 size = ((size - 1) | CachePage::kLineMask) + 1;
679 int offset = (start & CachePage::kPageMask);
680 while (!AllOnOnePage(start, size - 1)) {
681 int bytes_to_flush = CachePage::kPageSize - offset;
682 FlushOnePage(i_cache, start, bytes_to_flush);
683 start += bytes_to_flush;
684 size -= bytes_to_flush;
685 DCHECK_EQ(0, static_cast<int>(start & CachePage::kPageMask));
686 offset = 0;
687 }
688 if (size != 0) {
689 FlushOnePage(i_cache, start, size);
690 }
691}
692
693CachePage* Simulator::GetCachePage(base::CustomMatcherHashMap* i_cache,
694 void* page) {
695 base::HashMap::Entry* entry = i_cache->LookupOrInsert(page, ICacheHash(page));
696 if (entry->value == nullptr) {
697 CachePage* new_page = new CachePage();
698 entry->value = new_page;
699 }
700 return reinterpret_cast<CachePage*>(entry->value);
701}
702
703// Flush from start up to and not including start + size.
704void Simulator::FlushOnePage(base::CustomMatcherHashMap* i_cache,
705 intptr_t start, int size) {
706 DCHECK_LE(size, CachePage::kPageSize);
707 DCHECK(AllOnOnePage(start, size - 1));
708 DCHECK_EQ(start & CachePage::kLineMask, 0);
709 DCHECK_EQ(size & CachePage::kLineMask, 0);
710 void* page = reinterpret_cast<void*>(start & (~CachePage::kPageMask));
711 int offset = (start & CachePage::kPageMask);
712 CachePage* cache_page = GetCachePage(i_cache, page);
713 char* valid_bytemap = cache_page->ValidityByte(offset);
714 memset(valid_bytemap, CachePage::LINE_INVALID, size >> CachePage::kLineShift);
715}
716
717void Simulator::CheckICache(base::CustomMatcherHashMap* i_cache,
718 Instruction* instr) {
719 intptr_t address = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(instr);
720 void* page = reinterpret_cast<void*>(address & (~CachePage::kPageMask));
721 void* line = reinterpret_cast<void*>(address & (~CachePage::kLineMask));
722 int offset = (address & CachePage::kPageMask);
723 CachePage* cache_page = GetCachePage(i_cache, page);
724 char* cache_valid_byte = cache_page->ValidityByte(offset);
725 bool cache_hit = (*cache_valid_byte == CachePage::LINE_VALID);
726 char* cached_line = cache_page->CachedData(offset & ~CachePage::kLineMask);
727 if (cache_hit) {
728 // Check that the data in memory matches the contents of the I-cache.
729 CHECK_EQ(0, memcmp(reinterpret_cast<void*>(instr),
730 cache_page->CachedData(offset), kInstrSize));
731 } else {
732 // Cache miss. Load memory into the cache.
733 memcpy(cached_line, line, CachePage::kLineLength);
734 *cache_valid_byte = CachePage::LINE_VALID;
735 }
736}
737
738Simulator::Simulator(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {
739// Set up simulator support first. Some of this information is needed to
740// setup the architecture state.
741 stack_ = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(base::Malloc(AllocatedStackSize()));
742 pc_modified_ = false;
743 icount_ = 0;
744 break_pc_ = nullptr;
745 break_instr_ = 0;
746
747 // Set up architecture state.
748 // All registers are initialized to zero to start with.
749 for (int i = 0; i < kNumGPRs; i++) {
750 registers_[i] = 0;
751 }
752 condition_reg_ = 0;
753 fp_condition_reg_ = 0;
754 special_reg_pc_ = 0;
755 special_reg_lr_ = 0;
756 special_reg_ctr_ = 0;
757
758 // Initializing FP registers.
759 for (int i = 0; i < kNumFPRs; i++) {
760 fp_registers_[i] = 0.0;
761 }
762
763 // The sp is initialized to point to the bottom (high address) of the
764 // allocated stack area. To be safe in potential stack underflows we leave
765 // some buffer below.
766 registers_[sp] = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(stack_) + UsableStackSize();
767
768 last_debugger_input_ = nullptr;
769}
770
771Simulator::~Simulator() { base::Free(stack_); }
772
773// Get the active Simulator for the current thread.
774Simulator* Simulator::current(Isolate* isolate) {
775 v8::internal::Isolate::PerIsolateThreadData* isolate_data =
776 isolate->FindOrAllocatePerThreadDataForThisThread();
777 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(isolate_data);
778
779 Simulator* sim = isolate_data->simulator();
780 if (sim == nullptr) {
781 // TODO(146): delete the simulator object when a thread/isolate goes away.
782 sim = new Simulator(isolate);
783 isolate_data->set_simulator(sim);
784 }
785 return sim;
786}
787
788// Sets the register in the architecture state.
789void Simulator::set_register(int reg, intptr_t value) {
790 DCHECK((reg >= 0) && (reg < kNumGPRs));
791 registers_[reg] = value;
792}
793
794// Get the register from the architecture state.
795intptr_t Simulator::get_register(int reg) const {
796 DCHECK((reg >= 0) && (reg < kNumGPRs));
797 // Stupid code added to avoid bug in GCC.
798 // See: http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=43949
799 if (reg >= kNumGPRs) return 0;
800 // End stupid code.
801 return registers_[reg];
802}
803
804double Simulator::get_double_from_register_pair(int reg) {
805 DCHECK((reg >= 0) && (reg < kNumGPRs) && ((reg % 2) == 0));
806
807 double dm_val = 0.0;
808#if !V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64 // doesn't make sense in 64bit mode
809 // Read the bits from the unsigned integer register_[] array
810 // into the double precision floating point value and return it.
811 char buffer[sizeof(fp_registers_[0])];
812 memcpy(buffer, &registers_[reg], 2 * sizeof(registers_[0]));
813 memcpy(&dm_val, buffer, 2 * sizeof(registers_[0]));
814#endif
815 return (dm_val);
816}
817
818// Raw access to the PC register.
819void Simulator::set_pc(intptr_t value) {
820 pc_modified_ = true;
821 special_reg_pc_ = value;
822}
823
824bool Simulator::has_bad_pc() const {
825 return ((special_reg_pc_ == bad_lr) || (special_reg_pc_ == end_sim_pc));
826}
827
828// Raw access to the PC register without the special adjustment when reading.
829intptr_t Simulator::get_pc() const { return special_reg_pc_; }
830
831// Accessor to the internal Link Register
832intptr_t Simulator::get_lr() const { return special_reg_lr_; }
833
834// Runtime FP routines take:
835// - two double arguments
836// - one double argument and zero or one integer arguments.
837// All are consructed here from d1, d2 and r3.
838void Simulator::GetFpArgs(double* x, double* y, intptr_t* z) {
839 *x = get_double_from_d_register(1);
840 *y = get_double_from_d_register(2);
841 *z = get_register(3);
842}
843
844// The return value is in d1.
845void Simulator::SetFpResult(const double& result) {
846 set_d_register_from_double(1, result);
847}
848
849void Simulator::TrashCallerSaveRegisters() {
850// We don't trash the registers with the return value.
851#if 0 // A good idea to trash volatile registers, needs to be done
852 registers_[2] = 0x50BAD4U;
853 registers_[3] = 0x50BAD4U;
854 registers_[12] = 0x50BAD4U;
855#endif
856}
857
858#define GENERATE_RW_FUNC(size, type) \
859 type Simulator::Read##size(uintptr_t addr) { \
860 type value; \
861 Read(addr, &value); \
862 return value; \
863 } \
864 type Simulator::ReadEx##size(uintptr_t addr) { \
865 type value; \
866 ReadEx(addr, &value); \
867 return value; \
868 } \
869 void Simulator::Write##size(uintptr_t addr, type value) { \
870 Write(addr, value); \
871 } \
872 int32_t Simulator::WriteEx##size(uintptr_t addr, type value) { \
873 return WriteEx(addr, value); \
874 }
875
876RW_VAR_LIST(GENERATE_RW_FUNC)
877#undef GENERATE_RW_FUNC
878
879// Returns the limit of the stack area to enable checking for stack overflows.
880uintptr_t Simulator::StackLimit(uintptr_t c_limit) const {
881 // The simulator uses a separate JS stack. If we have exhausted the C stack,
882 // we also drop down the JS limit to reflect the exhaustion on the JS stack.
883 if (base::Stack::GetCurrentStackPosition() < c_limit) {
884 return reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(get_sp());
885 }
886
887 // Otherwise the limit is the JS stack. Leave a safety margin to prevent
888 // overrunning the stack when pushing values.
889 return reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(stack_) + kStackProtectionSize;
890}
891
892base::Vector<uint8_t> Simulator::GetCurrentStackView() const {
893 // We do not add an additional safety margin as above in
894 // Simulator::StackLimit, as this is currently only used in wasm::StackMemory,
895 // which adds its own margin.
896 return base::VectorOf(stack_, UsableStackSize());
897}
898
899// Unsupported instructions use Format to print an error and stop execution.
900void Simulator::Format(Instruction* instr, const char* format) {
901 PrintF("Simulator found unsupported instruction:\n 0x%08" V8PRIxPTR ": %s\n",
902 reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(instr), format);
903 UNIMPLEMENTED();
904}
905
906// Calculate C flag value for additions.
907bool Simulator::CarryFrom(int32_t left, int32_t right, int32_t carry) {
908 uint32_t uleft = static_cast<uint32_t>(left);
909 uint32_t uright = static_cast<uint32_t>(right);
910 uint32_t urest = 0xFFFFFFFFU - uleft;
911
912 return (uright > urest) ||
913 (carry && (((uright + 1) > urest) || (uright > (urest - 1))));
914}
915
916// Calculate C flag value for subtractions.
917bool Simulator::BorrowFrom(int32_t left, int32_t right) {
918 uint32_t uleft = static_cast<uint32_t>(left);
919 uint32_t uright = static_cast<uint32_t>(right);
920
921 return (uright > uleft);
922}
923
924// Calculate V flag value for additions and subtractions.
925bool Simulator::OverflowFrom(int32_t alu_out, int32_t left, int32_t right,
926 bool addition) {
927 bool overflow;
928 if (addition) {
929 // operands have the same sign
930 overflow = ((left >= 0 && right >= 0) || (left < 0 && right < 0))
931 // and operands and result have different sign
932 && ((left < 0 && alu_out >= 0) || (left >= 0 && alu_out < 0));
933 } else {
934 // operands have different signs
935 overflow = ((left < 0 && right >= 0) || (left >= 0 && right < 0))
936 // and first operand and result have different signs
937 && ((left < 0 && alu_out >= 0) || (left >= 0 && alu_out < 0));
938 }
939 return overflow;
940}
941
942static void decodeObjectPair(ObjectPair* pair, intptr_t* x, intptr_t* y) {
943 *x = static_cast<intptr_t>(pair->x);
944 *y = static_cast<intptr_t>(pair->y);
945}
946
947// Calls into the V8 runtime.
948using SimulatorRuntimeCall = intptr_t (*)(
949 intptr_t arg0, intptr_t arg1, intptr_t arg2, intptr_t arg3, intptr_t arg4,
950 intptr_t arg5, intptr_t arg6, intptr_t arg7, intptr_t arg8, intptr_t arg9,
951 intptr_t arg10, intptr_t arg11, intptr_t arg12, intptr_t arg13,
952 intptr_t arg14, intptr_t arg15, intptr_t arg16, intptr_t arg17,
953 intptr_t arg18, intptr_t arg19);
954using SimulatorRuntimePairCall = ObjectPair (*)(
955 intptr_t arg0, intptr_t arg1, intptr_t arg2, intptr_t arg3, intptr_t arg4,
956 intptr_t arg5, intptr_t arg6, intptr_t arg7, intptr_t arg8, intptr_t arg9,
957 intptr_t arg10, intptr_t arg11, intptr_t arg12, intptr_t arg13,
958 intptr_t arg14, intptr_t arg15, intptr_t arg16, intptr_t arg17,
959 intptr_t arg18, intptr_t arg19);
960
961// These prototypes handle the four types of FP calls.
962using SimulatorRuntimeCompareCall = int (*)(double darg0, double darg1);
963using SimulatorRuntimeFPFPCall = double (*)(double darg0, double darg1);
964using SimulatorRuntimeFPCall = double (*)(double darg0);
965using SimulatorRuntimeFPIntCall = double (*)(double darg0, intptr_t arg0);
966// Define four args for future flexibility; at the time of this writing only
967// one is ever used.
968using SimulatorRuntimeFPTaggedCall = double (*)(int32_t arg0, int32_t arg1,
969 int32_t arg2, int32_t arg3);
970
971// This signature supports direct call in to API function native callback
972// (refer to InvocationCallback in v8.h).
973using SimulatorRuntimeDirectApiCall = void (*)(intptr_t arg0);
974
975// This signature supports direct call to accessor getter callback.
976using SimulatorRuntimeDirectGetterCall = void (*)(intptr_t arg0, intptr_t arg1);
977
978// Software interrupt instructions are used by the simulator to call into the
979// C-based V8 runtime.
980void Simulator::SoftwareInterrupt(Instruction* instr) {
981 int svc = instr->SvcValue();
982 switch (svc) {
983 case kCallRtRedirected: {
984 // Check if stack is aligned. Error if not aligned is reported below to
985 // include information on the function called.
986 bool stack_aligned =
987 (get_register(sp) & (v8_flags.sim_stack_alignment - 1)) == 0;
988 Redirection* redirection = Redirection::FromInstruction(instr);
989 const int kArgCount = 20;
990 const int kRegisterArgCount = 8;
991 int arg0_regnum = 3;
992 intptr_t result_buffer = 0;
993 bool uses_result_buffer =
994 (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_CALL_PAIR &&
995 !ABI_RETURNS_OBJECT_PAIRS_IN_REGS);
996 if (uses_result_buffer) {
997 result_buffer = get_register(r3);
998 arg0_regnum++;
999 }
1000 intptr_t arg[kArgCount];
1001 // First eight arguments in registers r3-r10.
1002 for (int i = 0; i < kRegisterArgCount; i++) {
1003 arg[i] = get_register(arg0_regnum + i);
1004 }
1005 intptr_t* stack_pointer = reinterpret_cast<intptr_t*>(get_register(sp));
1006 // Remaining argument on stack
1007 for (int i = kRegisterArgCount, j = 0; i < kArgCount; i++, j++) {
1008 arg[i] = stack_pointer[kStackFrameExtraParamSlot + j];
1009 }
1010 static_assert(kArgCount == kRegisterArgCount + 12);
1011 static_assert(kMaxCParameters == kArgCount);
1012 bool fp_call =
1013 (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_FP_CALL) ||
1014 (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_COMPARE_CALL) ||
1015 (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_CALL) ||
1016 (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_INT_CALL);
1017 // This is dodgy but it works because the C entry stubs are never moved.
1018 // See comment in codegen-arm.cc and bug 1242173.
1019 intptr_t saved_lr = special_reg_lr_;
1020 intptr_t external =
1021 reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(redirection->external_function());
1022 if (fp_call) {
1023 double dval0, dval1; // one or two double parameters
1024 intptr_t ival; // zero or one integer parameters
1025 int iresult = 0; // integer return value
1026 double dresult = 0; // double return value
1027 GetFpArgs(&dval0, &dval1, &ival);
1028 if (v8_flags.trace_sim || !stack_aligned) {
1029 SimulatorRuntimeCall generic_target =
1030 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeCall>(external);
1031 switch (redirection->type()) {
1032 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_FP_CALL:
1033 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_COMPARE_CALL:
1034 PrintF("Call to host function at %p with args %f, %f",
1035 reinterpret_cast<void*>(FUNCTION_ADDR(generic_target)),
1036 dval0, dval1);
1037 break;
1038 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_CALL:
1039 PrintF("Call to host function at %p with arg %f",
1040 reinterpret_cast<void*>(FUNCTION_ADDR(generic_target)),
1041 dval0);
1042 break;
1043 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_INT_CALL:
1044 PrintF("Call to host function at %p with args %f, %" V8PRIdPTR,
1045 reinterpret_cast<void*>(FUNCTION_ADDR(generic_target)),
1046 dval0, ival);
1047 break;
1048 default:
1049 UNREACHABLE();
1050 }
1051 if (!stack_aligned) {
1052 PrintF(" with unaligned stack %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n",
1053 get_register(sp));
1054 }
1055 PrintF("\n");
1056 }
1057 CHECK(stack_aligned);
1058 switch (redirection->type()) {
1059 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_COMPARE_CALL: {
1060 SimulatorRuntimeCompareCall target =
1061 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeCompareCall>(external);
1062 iresult = target(dval0, dval1);
1063 set_register(r3, iresult);
1064 break;
1065 }
1066 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_FP_CALL: {
1067 SimulatorRuntimeFPFPCall target =
1068 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeFPFPCall>(external);
1069 dresult = target(dval0, dval1);
1070 SetFpResult(dresult);
1071 break;
1072 }
1073 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_CALL: {
1074 SimulatorRuntimeFPCall target =
1075 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeFPCall>(external);
1076 dresult = target(dval0);
1077 SetFpResult(dresult);
1078 break;
1079 }
1080 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_INT_CALL: {
1081 SimulatorRuntimeFPIntCall target =
1082 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeFPIntCall>(external);
1083 dresult = target(dval0, ival);
1084 SetFpResult(dresult);
1085 break;
1086 }
1087 default:
1088 UNREACHABLE();
1089 }
1090 if (v8_flags.trace_sim) {
1091 switch (redirection->type()) {
1092 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_COMPARE_CALL:
1093 PrintF("Returned %08x\n", iresult);
1094 break;
1095 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_FP_CALL:
1096 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_CALL:
1097 case ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_INT_CALL:
1098 PrintF("Returned %f\n", dresult);
1099 break;
1100 default:
1101 UNREACHABLE();
1102 }
1103 }
1104 } else if (redirection->type() ==
1105 ExternalReference::BUILTIN_FP_POINTER_CALL) {
1106 if (v8_flags.trace_sim || !stack_aligned) {
1107 PrintF("Call to host function at %p args %08" V8PRIxPTR,
1108 reinterpret_cast<void*>(external), arg[0]);
1109 if (!stack_aligned) {
1110 PrintF(" with unaligned stack %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n",
1111 get_register(sp));
1112 }
1113 PrintF("\n");
1114 }
1115 CHECK(stack_aligned);
1116 SimulatorRuntimeFPTaggedCall target =
1117 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeFPTaggedCall>(external);
1118 double dresult = target(arg[0], arg[1], arg[2], arg[3]);
1119#ifdef DEBUG
1120 TrashCallerSaveRegisters();
1121#endif
1122 SetFpResult(dresult);
1123 if (v8_flags.trace_sim) {
1124 PrintF("Returned %f\n", dresult);
1125 }
1126 } else if (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::DIRECT_API_CALL) {
1127 // See callers of MacroAssembler::CallApiFunctionAndReturn for
1128 // explanation of register usage.
1129 // void f(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo&)
1130 if (v8_flags.trace_sim || !stack_aligned) {
1131 PrintF("Call to host function at %p args %08" V8PRIxPTR,
1132 reinterpret_cast<void*>(external), arg[0]);
1133 if (!stack_aligned) {
1134 PrintF(" with unaligned stack %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n",
1135 get_register(sp));
1136 }
1137 PrintF("\n");
1138 }
1139 CHECK(stack_aligned);
1140 SimulatorRuntimeDirectApiCall target =
1141 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeDirectApiCall>(external);
1142 target(arg[0]);
1143 } else if (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::DIRECT_GETTER_CALL) {
1144 // See callers of MacroAssembler::CallApiFunctionAndReturn for
1145 // explanation of register usage.
1146 // void f(v8::Local<String> property, v8::PropertyCallbackInfo& info)
1147 if (v8_flags.trace_sim || !stack_aligned) {
1148 PrintF("Call to host function at %p args %08" V8PRIxPTR
1149 " %08" V8PRIxPTR,
1150 reinterpret_cast<void*>(external), arg[0], arg[1]);
1151 if (!stack_aligned) {
1152 PrintF(" with unaligned stack %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n",
1153 get_register(sp));
1154 }
1155 PrintF("\n");
1156 }
1157 CHECK(stack_aligned);
1158 SimulatorRuntimeDirectGetterCall target =
1159 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeDirectGetterCall>(external);
1160 if (!ABI_PASSES_HANDLES_IN_REGS) {
1161 arg[0] = base::bit_cast<intptr_t>(arg[0]);
1162 }
1163 target(arg[0], arg[1]);
1164 } else {
1165 // builtin call.
1166 if (v8_flags.trace_sim || !stack_aligned) {
1167 SimulatorRuntimeCall target =
1168 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeCall>(external);
1169 PrintF(
1170 "Call to host function at %p,\n"
1171 "\t\t\t\targs %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1172 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1173 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1174 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1175 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1176 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR
1177 ", %08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR,
1178 reinterpret_cast<void*>(FUNCTION_ADDR(target)), arg[0], arg[1],
1179 arg[2], arg[3], arg[4], arg[5], arg[6], arg[7], arg[8], arg[9],
1180 arg[10], arg[11], arg[12], arg[13], arg[14], arg[15], arg[16],
1181 arg[17], arg[18], arg[19]);
1182 if (!stack_aligned) {
1183 PrintF(" with unaligned stack %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n",
1184 get_register(sp));
1185 }
1186 PrintF("\n");
1187 }
1188 CHECK(stack_aligned);
1189 if (redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_CALL_PAIR) {
1190 SimulatorRuntimePairCall target =
1191 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimePairCall>(external);
1192 ObjectPair result =
1193 target(arg[0], arg[1], arg[2], arg[3], arg[4], arg[5], arg[6],
1194 arg[7], arg[8], arg[9], arg[10], arg[11], arg[12], arg[13],
1195 arg[14], arg[15], arg[16], arg[17], arg[18], arg[19]);
1196 intptr_t x;
1197 intptr_t y;
1198 decodeObjectPair(&result, &x, &y);
1199 if (v8_flags.trace_sim) {
1200 PrintF("Returned {%08" V8PRIxPTR ", %08" V8PRIxPTR "}\n", x, y);
1201 }
1202 if (ABI_RETURNS_OBJECT_PAIRS_IN_REGS) {
1203 set_register(r3, x);
1204 set_register(r4, y);
1205 } else {
1206 memcpy(reinterpret_cast<void*>(result_buffer), &result,
1207 sizeof(ObjectPair));
1208 set_register(r3, result_buffer);
1209 }
1210 } else {
1211 // FAST_C_CALL is temporarily handled here as well, because we lack
1212 // proper support for direct C calls with FP params in the simulator.
1213 // The generic BUILTIN_CALL path assumes all parameters are passed in
1214 // the GP registers, thus supporting calling the slow callback without
1215 // crashing. The reason for that is that in the mjsunit tests we check
1216 // the `fast_c_api.supports_fp_params` (which is false on
1217 // non-simulator builds for arm/arm64), thus we expect that the slow
1218 // path will be called. And since the slow path passes the arguments
1219 // as a `const FunctionCallbackInfo<Value>&` (which is a GP argument),
1220 // the call is made correctly.
1221 DCHECK(redirection->type() == ExternalReference::BUILTIN_CALL ||
1222 redirection->type() == ExternalReference::FAST_C_CALL);
1223 SimulatorRuntimeCall target =
1224 reinterpret_cast<SimulatorRuntimeCall>(external);
1225 intptr_t result =
1226 target(arg[0], arg[1], arg[2], arg[3], arg[4], arg[5], arg[6],
1227 arg[7], arg[8], arg[9], arg[10], arg[11], arg[12], arg[13],
1228 arg[14], arg[15], arg[16], arg[17], arg[18], arg[19]);
1229 if (v8_flags.trace_sim) {
1230 PrintF("Returned %08" V8PRIxPTR "\n", result);
1231 }
1232 set_register(r3, result);
1233 }
1234 }
1235 set_pc(saved_lr);
1236 break;
1237 }
1238 case kBreakpoint:
1239 PPCDebugger(this).Debug();
1240 break;
1241 // stop uses all codes greater than 1 << 23.
1242 default:
1243 if (svc >= (1 << 23)) {
1244 uint32_t code = svc & kStopCodeMask;
1245 if (isWatchedStop(code)) {
1246 IncreaseStopCounter(code);
1247 }
1248 // Stop if it is enabled, otherwise go on jumping over the stop
1249 // and the message address.
1250 if (isEnabledStop(code)) {
1251 if (code != kMaxStopCode) {
1252 PrintF("Simulator hit stop %u. ", code);
1253 } else {
1254 PrintF("Simulator hit stop. ");
1255 }
1256 DebugAtNextPC();
1257 } else {
1258 set_pc(get_pc() + kInstrSize + kSystemPointerSize);
1259 }
1260 } else {
1261 // This is not a valid svc code.
1262 UNREACHABLE();
1263 }
1264 }
1265}
1266
1267// Stop helper functions.
1268bool Simulator::isStopInstruction(Instruction* instr) {
1269 return (instr->Bits(27, 24) == 0xF) && (instr->SvcValue() >= kStopCode);
1270}
1271
1272bool Simulator::isWatchedStop(uint32_t code) {
1273 DCHECK_LE(code, kMaxStopCode);
1274 return code < kNumOfWatchedStops;
1275}
1276
1277bool Simulator::isEnabledStop(uint32_t code) {
1278 DCHECK_LE(code, kMaxStopCode);
1279 // Unwatched stops are always enabled.
1280 return !isWatchedStop(code) ||
1281 !(watched_stops_[code].count & kStopDisabledBit);
1282}
1283
1284void Simulator::EnableStop(uint32_t code) {
1285 DCHECK(isWatchedStop(code));
1286 if (!isEnabledStop(code)) {
1287 watched_stops_[code].count &= ~kStopDisabledBit;
1288 }
1289}
1290
1291void Simulator::DisableStop(uint32_t code) {
1292 DCHECK(isWatchedStop(code));
1293 if (isEnabledStop(code)) {
1294 watched_stops_[code].count |= kStopDisabledBit;
1295 }
1296}
1297
1298void Simulator::IncreaseStopCounter(uint32_t code) {
1299 DCHECK_LE(code, kMaxStopCode);
1300 DCHECK(isWatchedStop(code));
1301 if ((watched_stops_[code].count & ~(1 << 31)) == 0x7FFFFFFF) {
1302 PrintF(
1303 "Stop counter for code %i has overflowed.\n"
1304 "Enabling this code and reseting the counter to 0.\n",
1305 code);
1306 watched_stops_[code].count = 0;
1307 EnableStop(code);
1308 } else {
1309 watched_stops_[code].count++;
1310 }
1311}
1312
1313// Print a stop status.
1314void Simulator::PrintStopInfo(uint32_t code) {
1315 DCHECK_LE(code, kMaxStopCode);
1316 if (!isWatchedStop(code)) {
1317 PrintF("Stop not watched.");
1318 } else {
1319 const char* state = isEnabledStop(code) ? "Enabled" : "Disabled";
1320 int32_t count = watched_stops_[code].count & ~kStopDisabledBit;
1321 // Don't print the state of unused breakpoints.
1322 if (count != 0) {
1323 if (watched_stops_[code].desc) {
1324 PrintF("stop %i - 0x%x: \t%s, \tcounter = %i, \t%s\n", code, code,
1325 state, count, watched_stops_[code].desc);
1326 } else {
1327 PrintF("stop %i - 0x%x: \t%s, \tcounter = %i\n", code, code, state,
1328 count);
1329 }
1330 }
1331 }
1332}
1333
1334void Simulator::SetCR0(intptr_t result, bool setSO) {
1335 int bf = 0;
1336 if (result < 0) {
1337 bf |= 0x80000000;
1338 }
1339 if (result > 0) {
1340 bf |= 0x40000000;
1341 }
1342 if (result == 0) {
1343 bf |= 0x20000000;
1344 }
1345 if (setSO) {
1346 bf |= 0x10000000;
1347 }
1348 condition_reg_ = (condition_reg_ & ~0xF0000000) | bf;
1349}
1350
1351void Simulator::SetCR6(bool true_for_all) {
1352 int32_t clear_cr6_mask = 0xFFFFFF0F;
1353 if (true_for_all) {
1354 condition_reg_ = (condition_reg_ & clear_cr6_mask) | 0x80;
1355 } else {
1356 condition_reg_ = (condition_reg_ & clear_cr6_mask) | 0x20;
1357 }
1358}
1359
1360void Simulator::ExecuteBranchConditional(Instruction* instr, BCType type) {
1361 int bo = instr->Bits(25, 21) << 21;
1362 int condition_bit = instr->Bits(20, 16);
1363 int condition_mask = 0x80000000 >> condition_bit;
1364 switch (bo) {
1365 case DCBNZF: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR != 0 and condition false
1366 case DCBEZF: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR == 0 and condition false
1367 UNIMPLEMENTED();
1368 case BF: { // Branch if condition false
1369 if (condition_reg_ & condition_mask) return;
1370 break;
1371 }
1372 case DCBNZT: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR != 0 and condition true
1373 case DCBEZT: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR == 0 and condition true
1374 UNIMPLEMENTED();
1375 case BT: { // Branch if condition true
1376 if (!(condition_reg_ & condition_mask)) return;
1377 break;
1378 }
1379 case DCBNZ: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR != 0
1380 case DCBEZ: // Decrement CTR; branch if CTR == 0
1381 special_reg_ctr_ -= 1;
1382 if ((special_reg_ctr_ == 0) != (bo == DCBEZ)) return;
1383 break;
1384 case BA: { // Branch always
1385 break;
1386 }
1387 default:
1388 UNIMPLEMENTED(); // Invalid encoding
1389 }
1390
1391 intptr_t old_pc = get_pc();
1392
1393 switch (type) {
1394 case BC_OFFSET: {
1395 int offset = (instr->Bits(15, 2) << 18) >> 16;
1396 set_pc(old_pc + offset);
1397 break;
1398 }
1399 case BC_LINK_REG:
1400 set_pc(special_reg_lr_);
1401 break;
1402 case BC_CTR_REG:
1403 set_pc(special_reg_ctr_);
1404 break;
1405 }
1406
1407 if (instr->Bit(0) == 1) { // LK flag set
1408 special_reg_lr_ = old_pc + 4;
1409 }
1410}
1411
1412// Vector instruction helpers.
1413#define GET_ADDRESS(a, b, a_val, b_val) \
1414 intptr_t a_val = a == 0 ? 0 : get_register(a); \
1415 intptr_t b_val = get_register(b);
1416#define DECODE_VX_INSTRUCTION(d, a, b, source_or_target) \
1417 int d = instr->R##source_or_target##Value(); \
1418 int a = instr->RAValue(); \
1419 int b = instr->RBValue();
1420#define FOR_EACH_LANE(i, type) \
1421 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < kSimd128Size / sizeof(type); i++)
1422template <typename A, typename T, typename Operation>
1423void VectorCompareOp(Simulator* sim, Instruction* instr, bool is_fp,
1424 Operation op) {
1425 DECODE_VX_INSTRUCTION(t, a, b, T)
1426 bool true_for_all = true;
1427 FOR_EACH_LANE(i, A) {
1428 A a_val = sim->get_simd_register_by_lane<A>(a, i);
1429 A b_val = sim->get_simd_register_by_lane<A>(b, i);
1430 T t_val = 0;
1431 bool is_not_nan = is_fp ? !isnan(a_val) && !isnan(b_val) : true;
1432 if (is_not_nan && op(a_val, b_val)) {
1433 t_val = -1; // Set all bits to 1 indicating true.
1434 } else {
1435 true_for_all = false;
1436 }
1437 sim->set_simd_register_by_lane<T>(t, i, t_val);
1438 }
1439 if (instr->Bit(10)) { // RC bit set.
1440 sim->SetCR6(true_for_all);
1441 }
1442}
1443
1444template <typename S, typename T>
1445void VectorConverFromFPSaturate(Simulator* sim, Instruction* instr, T min_val,
1446 T max_val, bool even_lane_result = false) {
1447 int t = instr->RTValue();
1448 int b = instr->RBValue();
1449 FOR_EACH_LANE(i, S) {
1450 T t_val;
1451 double b_val = static_cast<double>(sim->get_simd_register_by_lane<S>(b, i));
1452 if (isnan(b_val)) {
1453 t_val = min_val;
1454 } else {
1455 // Round Towards Zero.
1456 b_val = std::trunc(b_val);
1457 if (b_val < min_val) {
1458 t_val = min_val;
1459 } else if (b_val > max_val) {
1460 t_val = max_val;
1461 } else {
1462 t_val = static_cast<T>(b_val);
1463 }
1464 }
1465 sim->set_simd_register_by_lane<T>(t, even_lane_result ? 2 * i : i, t_val);
1466 }
1467}
1468
1469template <typename S, typename T>
1470void VectorPackSaturate(Simulator* sim, Instruction* instr, S min_val,
1471 S max_val) {
1472 DECODE_VX_INSTRUCTION(t, a, b, T)
1473 int src = a;
1474 int count = 0;
1475 S value = 0;
1476 // Setup a temp array to avoid overwriting dst mid loop.
1477 T temps[kSimd128Size / sizeof(T)] = {0};
1478 for (size_t i = 0; i < kSimd128Size / sizeof(T); i++, count++) {
1479 if (count == kSimd128Size / sizeof(S)) {
1480 src = b;
1481 count = 0;
1482 }
1483 value = sim->get_simd_register_by_lane<S>(src, count);
1484 if (value > max_val) {
1485 value = max_val;
1486 } else if (value < min_val) {
1487 value = min_val;
1488 }
1489 temps[i] = static_cast<T>(value);
1490 }
1491 FOR_EACH_LANE(i, T) { sim->set_simd_register_by_lane<T>(t, i, temps[i]); }
1492}
1493
1494template <typename T>
1495T VSXFPMin(T x, T y) {
1496 // Handle NaN.
1497 // TODO(miladfarca): include the payload of src1.
1498 if (std::isnan(x) && std::isnan(y)) return NAN;
1499 // Handle +0 and -0.
1500 if (std::signbit(x) < std::signbit(y)) return y;
1501 if (std::signbit(y) < std::signbit(x)) return x;
1502 return std::fmin(x, y);
1503}
1504
1505template <typename T>
1506T VSXFPMax(T x, T y) {
1507 // Handle NaN.
1508 // TODO(miladfarca): include the payload of src1.
1509 if (std::isnan(x) && std::isnan(y)) return NAN;
1510 // Handle +0 and -0.
1511 if (std::signbit(x) < std::signbit(y)) return x;
1512 if (std::signbit(y) < std::signbit(x)) return y;
1513 return std::fmax(x, y);
1514}
1515
1516float VMXFPMin(float x, float y) {
1517 // Handle NaN.
1518 if (std::isnan(x) || std::isnan(y)) return NAN;
1519 // Handle +0 and -0.
1520 if (std::signbit(x) < std::signbit(y)) return y;
1521 if (std::signbit(y) < std::signbit(x)) return x;
1522 return x < y ? x : y;
1523}
1524
1525float VMXFPMax(float x, float y) {
1526 // Handle NaN.
1527 if (std::isnan(x) || std::isnan(y)) return NAN;
1528 // Handle +0 and -0.
1529 if (std::signbit(x) < std::signbit(y)) return x;
1530 if (std::signbit(y) < std::signbit(x)) return y;
1531 return x > y ? x : y;
1532}
1533
1534void Simulator::ExecuteGeneric(Instruction* instr) {
1535 uint32_t opcode = instr->OpcodeBase();
1536 switch (opcode) {
1537 // Prefixed instructions.
1538 case PLOAD_STORE_8LS:
1539 case PLOAD_STORE_MLS: {
1540 // TODO(miladfarca): Simulate PC-relative capability indicated by the R
1541 // bit.
1542 DCHECK_NE(instr->Bit(20), 1);
1543 // Read prefix value.
1544 uint64_t prefix_value = instr->Bits(17, 0);
1545 // Read suffix (next instruction).
1546 Instruction* next_instr =
1547 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(get_pc() + kInstrSize);
1548 uint16_t suffix_value = next_instr->Bits(15, 0);
1549 int64_t im_val = SIGN_EXT_IMM34((prefix_value << 16) | suffix_value);
1550 switch (next_instr->OpcodeBase()) {
1551 // Prefixed ADDI.
1552 case ADDI: {
1553 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1554 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1555 intptr_t alu_out;
1556 if (ra == 0) {
1557 alu_out = im_val;
1558 } else {
1559 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1560 alu_out = ra_val + im_val;
1561 }
1562 set_register(rt, alu_out);
1563 break;
1564 }
1565 // Prefixed LBZ.
1566 case LBZ: {
1567 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1568 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1569 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1570 set_register(rt, ReadB(ra_val + im_val) & 0xFF);
1571 break;
1572 }
1573 // Prefixed LHZ.
1574 case LHZ: {
1575 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1576 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1577 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1578 uintptr_t result = ReadHU(ra_val + im_val) & 0xFFFF;
1579 set_register(rt, result);
1580 break;
1581 }
1582 // Prefixed LHA.
1583 case LHA: {
1584 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1585 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1586 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1587 intptr_t result = ReadH(ra_val + im_val);
1588 set_register(rt, result);
1589 break;
1590 }
1591 // Prefixed LWZ.
1592 case LWZ: {
1593 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1594 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1595 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1596 set_register(rt, ReadWU(ra_val + im_val));
1597 break;
1598 }
1599 // Prefixed LWA.
1600 case PPLWA: {
1601 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1602 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1603 int64_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1604 set_register(rt, ReadW(ra_val + im_val));
1605 break;
1606 }
1607 // Prefixed LD.
1608 case PPLD: {
1609 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1610 int rt = next_instr->RTValue();
1611 int64_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1612 set_register(rt, ReadDW(ra_val + im_val));
1613 break;
1614 }
1615 // Prefixed LFS.
1616 case LFS: {
1617 int frt = next_instr->RTValue();
1618 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1619 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1620 int32_t val = ReadW(ra_val + im_val);
1621 float* fptr = reinterpret_cast<float*>(&val);
1622#if V8_HOST_ARCH_IA32 || V8_HOST_ARCH_X64
1623 // Conversion using double changes sNan to qNan on ia32/x64
1624 if ((val & 0x7F800000) == 0x7F800000) {
1625 int64_t dval = static_cast<int64_t>(val);
1626 dval = ((dval & 0xC0000000) << 32) | ((dval & 0x40000000) << 31) |
1627 ((dval & 0x40000000) << 30) | ((dval & 0x7FFFFFFF) << 29) |
1628 0x0;
1629 set_d_register(frt, dval);
1630 } else {
1631 set_d_register_from_double(frt, static_cast<double>(*fptr));
1632 }
1633#else
1634 set_d_register_from_double(frt, static_cast<double>(*fptr));
1635#endif
1636 break;
1637 }
1638 // Prefixed LFD.
1639 case LFD: {
1640 int frt = next_instr->RTValue();
1641 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1642 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1643 int64_t dptr = ReadDW(ra_val + im_val);
1644 set_d_register(frt, dptr);
1645 break;
1646 }
1647 // Prefixed STB.
1648 case STB: {
1649 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1650 int rs = next_instr->RSValue();
1651 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1652 WriteB(ra_val + im_val, get_register(rs));
1653 break;
1654 }
1655 // Prefixed STH.
1656 case STH: {
1657 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1658 int rs = next_instr->RSValue();
1659 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1660 WriteH(ra_val + im_val, get_register(rs));
1661 break;
1662 }
1663 // Prefixed STW.
1664 case STW: {
1665 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1666 int rs = next_instr->RSValue();
1667 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1668 WriteW(ra_val + im_val, get_register(rs));
1669 break;
1670 }
1671 // Prefixed STD.
1672 case PPSTD: {
1673 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1674 int rs = next_instr->RSValue();
1675 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1676 WriteDW(ra_val + im_val, get_register(rs));
1677 break;
1678 }
1679 // Prefixed STFS.
1680 case STFS: {
1681 int frs = next_instr->RSValue();
1682 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1683 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1684 float frs_val = static_cast<float>(get_double_from_d_register(frs));
1685 int32_t* p;
1686#if V8_HOST_ARCH_IA32 || V8_HOST_ARCH_X64
1687 // Conversion using double changes sNan to qNan on ia32/x64
1688 int32_t sval = 0;
1689 int64_t dval = get_d_register(frs);
1690 if ((dval & 0x7FF0000000000000) == 0x7FF0000000000000) {
1691 sval = ((dval & 0xC000000000000000) >> 32) |
1692 ((dval & 0x07FFFFFFE0000000) >> 29);
1693 p = &sval;
1694 } else {
1695 p = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(&frs_val);
1696 }
1697#else
1698 p = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(&frs_val);
1699#endif
1700 WriteW(ra_val + im_val, *p);
1701 break;
1702 }
1703 // Prefixed STFD.
1704 case STFD: {
1705 int frs = next_instr->RSValue();
1706 int ra = next_instr->RAValue();
1707 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
1708 int64_t frs_val = get_d_register(frs);
1709 WriteDW(ra_val + im_val, frs_val);
1710 break;
1711 }
1712 default:
1713 UNREACHABLE();
1714 }
1715 // We have now executed instructions at this as well as next pc.
1716 set_pc(get_pc() + (2 * kInstrSize));
1717 break;
1718 }
1719 case SUBFIC: {
1720 int rt = instr->RTValue();
1721 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1722 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1723 int32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
1724 im_val = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(im_val);
1725 intptr_t alu_out = im_val - ra_val;
1726 set_register(rt, alu_out);
1727 // todo - handle RC bit
1728 break;
1729 }
1730 case CMPLI: {
1731 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1732 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
1733 int cr = instr->Bits(25, 23);
1734 uint32_t bf = 0;
1735#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
1736 int L = instr->Bit(21);
1737 if (L) {
1738#endif
1739 uintptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1740 if (ra_val < im_val) {
1741 bf |= 0x80000000;
1742 }
1743 if (ra_val > im_val) {
1744 bf |= 0x40000000;
1745 }
1746 if (ra_val == im_val) {
1747 bf |= 0x20000000;
1748 }
1749#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
1750 } else {
1751 uint32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1752 if (ra_val < im_val) {
1753 bf |= 0x80000000;
1754 }
1755 if (ra_val > im_val) {
1756 bf |= 0x40000000;
1757 }
1758 if (ra_val == im_val) {
1759 bf |= 0x20000000;
1760 }
1761 }
1762#endif
1763 uint32_t condition_mask = 0xF0000000U >> (cr * 4);
1764 uint32_t condition = bf >> (cr * 4);
1765 condition_reg_ = (condition_reg_ & ~condition_mask) | condition;
1766 break;
1767 }
1768 case CMPI: {
1769 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1770 int32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
1771 im_val = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(im_val);
1772 int cr = instr->Bits(25, 23);
1773 uint32_t bf = 0;
1774#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
1775 int L = instr->Bit(21);
1776 if (L) {
1777#endif
1778 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1779 if (ra_val < im_val) {
1780 bf |= 0x80000000;
1781 }
1782 if (ra_val > im_val) {
1783 bf |= 0x40000000;
1784 }
1785 if (ra_val == im_val) {
1786 bf |= 0x20000000;
1787 }
1788#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
1789 } else {
1790 int32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1791 if (ra_val < im_val) {
1792 bf |= 0x80000000;
1793 }
1794 if (ra_val > im_val) {
1795 bf |= 0x40000000;
1796 }
1797 if (ra_val == im_val) {
1798 bf |= 0x20000000;
1799 }
1800 }
1801#endif
1802 uint32_t condition_mask = 0xF0000000U >> (cr * 4);
1803 uint32_t condition = bf >> (cr * 4);
1804 condition_reg_ = (condition_reg_ & ~condition_mask) | condition;
1805 break;
1806 }
1807 case ADDIC: {
1808 int rt = instr->RTValue();
1809 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1810 uintptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1811 uintptr_t im_val = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(instr->Bits(15, 0));
1812 uintptr_t alu_out = ra_val + im_val;
1813 // Check overflow
1814 if (~ra_val < im_val) {
1815 special_reg_xer_ = (special_reg_xer_ & ~0xF0000000) | 0x20000000;
1816 } else {
1817 special_reg_xer_ &= ~0xF0000000;
1818 }
1819 set_register(rt, alu_out);
1820 break;
1821 }
1822 case ADDI: {
1823 int rt = instr->RTValue();
1824 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1825 int32_t im_val = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(instr->Bits(15, 0));
1826 intptr_t alu_out;
1827 if (ra == 0) {
1828 alu_out = im_val;
1829 } else {
1830 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1831 alu_out = ra_val + im_val;
1832 }
1833 set_register(rt, alu_out);
1834 // todo - handle RC bit
1835 break;
1836 }
1837 case ADDIS: {
1838 int rt = instr->RTValue();
1839 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1840 int32_t im_val = (instr->Bits(15, 0) << 16);
1841 intptr_t alu_out;
1842 if (ra == 0) { // treat r0 as zero
1843 alu_out = im_val;
1844 } else {
1845 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1846 alu_out = ra_val + im_val;
1847 }
1848 set_register(rt, alu_out);
1849 break;
1850 }
1851 case BCX: {
1852 ExecuteBranchConditional(instr, BC_OFFSET);
1853 break;
1854 }
1855 case BX: {
1856 int offset = (instr->Bits(25, 2) << 8) >> 6;
1857 if (instr->Bit(0) == 1) { // LK flag set
1858 special_reg_lr_ = get_pc() + 4;
1859 }
1860 set_pc(get_pc() + offset);
1861 // todo - AA flag
1862 break;
1863 }
1864 case MCRF:
1865 UNIMPLEMENTED(); // Not used by V8.
1866 case BCLRX:
1867 ExecuteBranchConditional(instr, BC_LINK_REG);
1868 break;
1869 case BCCTRX:
1870 ExecuteBranchConditional(instr, BC_CTR_REG);
1871 break;
1872 case CRNOR:
1873 case RFI:
1874 case CRANDC:
1875 UNIMPLEMENTED();
1876 case ISYNC: {
1877 // todo - simulate isync
1878 break;
1879 }
1880 case CRXOR: {
1881 int bt = instr->Bits(25, 21);
1882 int ba = instr->Bits(20, 16);
1883 int bb = instr->Bits(15, 11);
1884 int ba_val = ((0x80000000 >> ba) & condition_reg_) == 0 ? 0 : 1;
1885 int bb_val = ((0x80000000 >> bb) & condition_reg_) == 0 ? 0 : 1;
1886 int bt_val = ba_val ^ bb_val;
1887 bt_val = bt_val << (31 - bt); // shift bit to correct destination
1888 condition_reg_ &= ~(0x80000000 >> bt);
1889 condition_reg_ |= bt_val;
1890 break;
1891 }
1892 case CREQV: {
1893 int bt = instr->Bits(25, 21);
1894 int ba = instr->Bits(20, 16);
1895 int bb = instr->Bits(15, 11);
1896 int ba_val = ((0x80000000 >> ba) & condition_reg_) == 0 ? 0 : 1;
1897 int bb_val = ((0x80000000 >> bb) & condition_reg_) == 0 ? 0 : 1;
1898 int bt_val = 1 - (ba_val ^ bb_val);
1899 bt_val = bt_val << (31 - bt); // shift bit to correct destination
1900 condition_reg_ &= ~(0x80000000 >> bt);
1901 condition_reg_ |= bt_val;
1902 break;
1903 }
1904 case CRNAND:
1905 case CRAND:
1906 case CRORC:
1907 case CROR: {
1908 UNIMPLEMENTED(); // Not used by V8.
1909 }
1910 case RLWIMIX: {
1911 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1912 int rs = instr->RSValue();
1913 uint32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
1914 int32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
1915 int sh = instr->Bits(15, 11);
1916 int mb = instr->Bits(10, 6);
1917 int me = instr->Bits(5, 1);
1918 uint32_t result = base::bits::RotateLeft32(rs_val, sh);
1919 int mask = 0;
1920 if (mb < me + 1) {
1921 int bit = 0x80000000 >> mb;
1922 for (; mb <= me; mb++) {
1923 mask |= bit;
1924 bit >>= 1;
1925 }
1926 } else if (mb == me + 1) {
1927 mask = 0xFFFFFFFF;
1928 } else { // mb > me+1
1929 int bit = 0x80000000 >> (me + 1); // needs to be tested
1930 mask = 0xFFFFFFFF;
1931 for (; me < mb; me++) {
1932 mask ^= bit;
1933 bit >>= 1;
1934 }
1935 }
1936 result &= mask;
1937 ra_val &= ~mask;
1938 result |= ra_val;
1939 set_register(ra, result);
1940 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
1941 SetCR0(result);
1942 }
1943 break;
1944 }
1945 case RLWINMX:
1946 case RLWNMX: {
1947 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1948 int rs = instr->RSValue();
1949 uint32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
1950 int sh = 0;
1951 if (opcode == RLWINMX) {
1952 sh = instr->Bits(15, 11);
1953 } else {
1954 int rb = instr->RBValue();
1955 uint32_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
1956 sh = (rb_val & 0x1F);
1957 }
1958 int mb = instr->Bits(10, 6);
1959 int me = instr->Bits(5, 1);
1960 uint32_t result = base::bits::RotateLeft32(rs_val, sh);
1961 int mask = 0;
1962 if (mb < me + 1) {
1963 int bit = 0x80000000 >> mb;
1964 for (; mb <= me; mb++) {
1965 mask |= bit;
1966 bit >>= 1;
1967 }
1968 } else if (mb == me + 1) {
1969 mask = 0xFFFFFFFF;
1970 } else { // mb > me+1
1971 int bit = 0x80000000 >> (me + 1); // needs to be tested
1972 mask = 0xFFFFFFFF;
1973 for (; me < mb; me++) {
1974 mask ^= bit;
1975 bit >>= 1;
1976 }
1977 }
1978 result &= mask;
1979 set_register(ra, result);
1980 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
1981 SetCR0(result);
1982 }
1983 break;
1984 }
1985 case ORI: {
1986 int rs = instr->RSValue();
1987 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1988 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
1989 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
1990 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val | im_val;
1991 set_register(ra, alu_out);
1992 break;
1993 }
1994 case ORIS: {
1995 int rs = instr->RSValue();
1996 int ra = instr->RAValue();
1997 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
1998 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
1999 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val | (im_val << 16);
2000 set_register(ra, alu_out);
2001 break;
2002 }
2003 case XORI: {
2004 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2005 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2006 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2007 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
2008 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val ^ im_val;
2009 set_register(ra, alu_out);
2010 // todo - set condition based SO bit
2011 break;
2012 }
2013 case XORIS: {
2014 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2015 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2016 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2017 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
2018 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val ^ (im_val << 16);
2019 set_register(ra, alu_out);
2020 break;
2021 }
2022 case ANDIx: {
2023 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2024 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2025 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2026 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
2027 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val & im_val;
2028 set_register(ra, alu_out);
2029 SetCR0(alu_out);
2030 break;
2031 }
2032 case ANDISx: {
2033 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2034 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2035 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2036 uint32_t im_val = instr->Bits(15, 0);
2037 intptr_t alu_out = rs_val & (im_val << 16);
2038 set_register(ra, alu_out);
2039 SetCR0(alu_out);
2040 break;
2041 }
2042 case SRWX: {
2043 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2044 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2045 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2046 uint32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2047 uintptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb) & 0x3F;
2048 intptr_t result = (rb_val > 31) ? 0 : rs_val >> rb_val;
2049 set_register(ra, result);
2050 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2051 SetCR0(result);
2052 }
2053 break;
2054 }
2055#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2056 case SRDX: {
2057 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2058 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2059 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2060 uintptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2061 uintptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb) & 0x7F;
2062 intptr_t result = (rb_val > 63) ? 0 : rs_val >> rb_val;
2063 set_register(ra, result);
2064 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2065 SetCR0(result);
2066 }
2067 break;
2068 }
2069#endif
2070 case MODUW: {
2071 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2072 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2073 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2074 uint32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2075 uint32_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2076 uint32_t alu_out = (rb_val == 0) ? -1 : ra_val % rb_val;
2077 set_register(rt, alu_out);
2078 break;
2079 }
2080#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2081 case MODUD: {
2082 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2083 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2084 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2085 uint64_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2086 uint64_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2087 uint64_t alu_out = (rb_val == 0) ? -1 : ra_val % rb_val;
2088 set_register(rt, alu_out);
2089 break;
2090 }
2091#endif
2092 case MODSW: {
2093 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2094 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2095 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2096 int32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2097 int32_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2098 bool overflow = (ra_val == kMinInt && rb_val == -1);
2099 // result is undefined if divisor is zero or if operation
2100 // is 0x80000000 / -1.
2101 int32_t alu_out = (rb_val == 0 || overflow) ? -1 : ra_val % rb_val;
2102 set_register(rt, alu_out);
2103 break;
2104 }
2105#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2106 case MODSD: {
2107 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2108 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2109 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2110 int64_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2111 int64_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2112 int64_t one = 1; // work-around gcc
2113 int64_t kMinLongLong = (one << 63);
2114 // result is undefined if divisor is zero or if operation
2115 // is 0x80000000_00000000 / -1.
2116 int64_t alu_out =
2117 (rb_val == 0 || (ra_val == kMinLongLong && rb_val == -1))
2118 ? -1
2119 : ra_val % rb_val;
2120 set_register(rt, alu_out);
2121 break;
2122 }
2123#endif
2124 case SRAW: {
2125 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2126 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2127 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2128 int32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2129 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb) & 0x3F;
2130 intptr_t result = (rb_val > 31) ? rs_val >> 31 : rs_val >> rb_val;
2131 set_register(ra, result);
2132 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2133 SetCR0(result);
2134 }
2135 break;
2136 }
2137#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2138 case SRAD: {
2139 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2140 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2141 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2142 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2143 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb) & 0x7F;
2144 intptr_t result = (rb_val > 63) ? rs_val >> 63 : rs_val >> rb_val;
2145 set_register(ra, result);
2146 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2147 SetCR0(result);
2148 }
2149 break;
2150 }
2151#endif
2152 case SRAWIX: {
2153 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2154 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2155 int sh = instr->Bits(15, 11);
2156 int32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2157 intptr_t result = rs_val >> sh;
2158 set_register(ra, result);
2159 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2160 SetCR0(result);
2161 }
2162 break;
2163 }
2164#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2165 case EXTSW: {
2166 const int shift = kBitsPerSystemPointer - 32;
2167 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2168 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2169 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2170 intptr_t ra_val = (rs_val << shift) >> shift;
2171 set_register(ra, ra_val);
2172 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2173 SetCR0(ra_val);
2174 }
2175 break;
2176 }
2177#endif
2178 case EXTSH: {
2179 const int shift = kBitsPerSystemPointer - 16;
2180 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2181 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2182 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2183 intptr_t ra_val = (rs_val << shift) >> shift;
2184 set_register(ra, ra_val);
2185 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2186 SetCR0(ra_val);
2187 }
2188 break;
2189 }
2190 case EXTSB: {
2191 const int shift = kBitsPerSystemPointer - 8;
2192 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2193 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2194 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2195 intptr_t ra_val = (rs_val << shift) >> shift;
2196 set_register(ra, ra_val);
2197 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2198 SetCR0(ra_val);
2199 }
2200 break;
2201 }
2202 case LFSUX:
2203 case LFSX: {
2204 int frt = instr->RTValue();
2205 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2206 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2207 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2208 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2209 int32_t val = ReadW(ra_val + rb_val);
2210 float* fptr = reinterpret_cast<float*>(&val);
2211#if V8_HOST_ARCH_IA32 || V8_HOST_ARCH_X64
2212 // Conversion using double changes sNan to qNan on ia32/x64
2213 if ((val & 0x7F800000) == 0x7F800000) {
2214 int64_t dval = static_cast<int64_t>(val);
2215 dval = ((dval & 0xC0000000) << 32) | ((dval & 0x40000000) << 31) |
2216 ((dval & 0x40000000) << 30) | ((dval & 0x7FFFFFFF) << 29) | 0x0;
2217 set_d_register(frt, dval);
2218 } else {
2219 set_d_register_from_double(frt, static_cast<double>(*fptr));
2220 }
2221#else
2222 set_d_register_from_double(frt, static_cast<double>(*fptr));
2223#endif
2224 if (opcode == LFSUX) {
2225 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2226 set_register(ra, ra_val + rb_val);
2227 }
2228 break;
2229 }
2230 case LFDUX:
2231 case LFDX: {
2232 int frt = instr->RTValue();
2233 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2234 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2235 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2236 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2237 int64_t dptr = ReadDW(ra_val + rb_val);
2238 set_d_register(frt, dptr);
2239 if (opcode == LFDUX) {
2240 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2241 set_register(ra, ra_val + rb_val);
2242 }
2243 break;
2244 }
2245 case STFSUX:
2246 [[fallthrough]];
2247 case STFSX: {
2248 int frs = instr->RSValue();
2249 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2250 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2251 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2252 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2253 float frs_val = static_cast<float>(get_double_from_d_register(frs));
2254 int32_t* p = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(&frs_val);
2255#if V8_HOST_ARCH_IA32 || V8_HOST_ARCH_X64
2256 // Conversion using double changes sNan to qNan on ia32/x64
2257 int32_t sval = 0;
2258 int64_t dval = get_d_register(frs);
2259 if ((dval & 0x7FF0000000000000) == 0x7FF0000000000000) {
2260 sval = ((dval & 0xC000000000000000) >> 32) |
2261 ((dval & 0x07FFFFFFE0000000) >> 29);
2262 p = &sval;
2263 } else {
2264 p = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(&frs_val);
2265 }
2266#else
2267 p = reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(&frs_val);
2268#endif
2269 WriteW(ra_val + rb_val, *p);
2270 if (opcode == STFSUX) {
2271 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2272 set_register(ra, ra_val + rb_val);
2273 }
2274 break;
2275 }
2276 case STFDUX:
2277 [[fallthrough]];
2278 case STFDX: {
2279 int frs = instr->RSValue();
2280 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2281 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2282 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2283 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2284 int64_t frs_val = get_d_register(frs);
2285 WriteDW(ra_val + rb_val, frs_val);
2286 if (opcode == STFDUX) {
2287 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2288 set_register(ra, ra_val + rb_val);
2289 }
2290 break;
2291 }
2292 case POPCNTW: {
2293 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2294 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2295 uintptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2296 uintptr_t count = 0;
2297 int n = 0;
2298 uintptr_t bit = 0x80000000;
2299 for (; n < 32; n++) {
2300 if (bit & rs_val) count++;
2301 bit >>= 1;
2302 }
2303 set_register(ra, count);
2304 break;
2305 }
2306#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2307 case POPCNTD: {
2308 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2309 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2310 uintptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2311 uintptr_t count = 0;
2312 int n = 0;
2313 uintptr_t bit = 0x8000000000000000UL;
2314 for (; n < 64; n++) {
2315 if (bit & rs_val) count++;
2316 bit >>= 1;
2317 }
2318 set_register(ra, count);
2319 break;
2320 }
2321#endif
2322 case SYNC: {
2323 // todo - simulate sync
2324 __sync_synchronize();
2325 break;
2326 }
2327 case ICBI: {
2328 // todo - simulate icbi
2329 break;
2330 }
2331
2332 case LWZU:
2333 case LWZ: {
2334 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2335 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2336 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2337 int offset = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(instr->Bits(15, 0));
2338 set_register(rt, ReadWU(ra_val + offset));
2339 if (opcode == LWZU) {
2340 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2341 set_register(ra, ra_val + offset);
2342 }
2343 break;
2344 }
2345
2346 case LBZU:
2347 case LBZ: {
2348 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2349 int rt = instr->RTValue();
2350 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2351 int offset = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(instr->Bits(15, 0));
2352 set_register(rt, ReadB(ra_val + offset) & 0xFF);
2353 if (opcode == LBZU) {
2354 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2355 set_register(ra, ra_val + offset);
2356 }
2357 break;
2358 }
2359
2360 case STWU:
2361 case STW: {
2362 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2363 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2364 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2365 int32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2366 int offset = SIGN_EXT_IMM16(instr->Bits(15, 0));
2367 WriteW(ra_val + offset, rs_val);
2368 if (opcode == STWU) {
2369 DCHECK_NE(ra, 0);
2370 set_register(ra, ra_val + offset);
2371 }
2372 break;
2373 }
2374 case SRADIX: {
2375 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2376 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2377 int sh = (instr->Bits(15, 11) | (instr->Bit(1) << 5));
2378 intptr_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2379 intptr_t result = rs_val >> sh;
2380 set_register(ra, result);
2381 if (instr->Bit(0)) { // RC bit set
2382 SetCR0(result);
2383 }
2384 break;
2385 }
2386 case STBCX: {
2387 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2388 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2389 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2390 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2391 int8_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2392 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2393 SetCR0(WriteExB(ra_val + rb_val, rs_val));
2394 break;
2395 }
2396 case STHCX: {
2397 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2398 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2399 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2400 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2401 int16_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2402 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2403 SetCR0(WriteExH(ra_val + rb_val, rs_val));
2404 break;
2405 }
2406 case STWCX: {
2407 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2408 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2409 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2410 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2411 int32_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2412 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2413 SetCR0(WriteExW(ra_val + rb_val, rs_val));
2414 break;
2415 }
2416 case STDCX: {
2417 int rs = instr->RSValue();
2418 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2419 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2420 intptr_t ra_val = ra == 0 ? 0 : get_register(ra);
2421 int64_t rs_val = get_register(rs);
2422 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2423 SetCR0(WriteExDW(ra_val + rb_val, rs_val));
2424 break;
2425 }
2426 case TW: {
2427 // used for call redirection in simulation mode
2428 SoftwareInterrupt(instr);
2429 break;
2430 }
2431 case CMP: {
2432 int ra = instr->RAValue();
2433 int rb = instr->RBValue();
2434 int cr = instr->Bits(25, 23);
2435 uint32_t bf = 0;
2436#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2437 int L = instr->Bit(21);
2438 if (L) {
2439#endif
2440 intptr_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2441 intptr_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2442 if (ra_val < rb_val) {
2443 bf |= 0x80000000;
2444 }
2445 if (ra_val > rb_val) {
2446 bf |= 0x40000000;
2447 }
2448 if (ra_val == rb_val) {
2449 bf |= 0x20000000;
2450 }
2451#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64
2452 } else {
2453 int32_t ra_val = get_register(ra);
2454 int32_t rb_val = get_register(rb);
2455 if (ra_val < rb_val) {
2456 bf |= 0x80000000;
2457 }
2458 if (ra_val > rb_val) {
2459 bf |= 0x40000000;
2460 }
2461 if (ra_val == rb_val) {
2462 bf |= 0x20000000;
2463 }
2464 }
2465#endif
2466 uint32_t condition_mask = 0xF0000000U >> (cr * 4);
2467 uint32_t condition = bf >> (cr * 4);
